Title.evidence: The present study was undertaken to examine the feasibility of assessing adjuvant statin therapy in patients with operable OAC in a phase III RCT.

Trial_Design.evidence: centrally allocated (1 : 1) to simvastatin 40 mg or matching placebo by block randomization, stratified by centre.

Participants.evidence: adults with OAC (including Siewert I–II lesions) who had undergone oesophagectomy

Intervention.evidence: centrally allocated (1 : 1) to simvastatin 40 mg or matching placebo

Objective.evidence: The present study was undertaken to examine the feasibility of assessing adjuvant statin therapy in patients with operable OAC in a phase III RCT.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: centrally allocated (1 : 1) to simvastatin 40 mg or matching placebo by block randomization, stratified by centre.

Blinding.evidence: Participants, clinicians and investigators were blinded to treatment allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 120 patients were assessed for eligibility at four centres, of whom 32 (26·7 per cent) were randomized, 16 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Participants allocated to simvastatin had lower low‐density lipoprotein cholesterol levels by 3 months (adjusted mean difference −0·83 (95 per cent c.i. −1·4 to −0·22) mmol/l; P = 0·009).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between the groups.
